title: 10 Offbeat Beaches In South India That Will Make You Go WOW!
text:
Travel Articles | August 3, 2015 
South India is land of beachs . The region has some of the most beautiful beaches owing to the blissful waters of Arabian Sea and most visited region in India, Indian Ocean and Bay of Bengal. 
South India is a landmass of India surrounded by waters on three sides. The region has some of the most beautiful beaches owing to the blissful waters of Arabian Sea, Indian Ocean and Bay of Bengal. Some of the beaches are still offbeat and unexplored. A memorable Beach trip in India is only complete when you have been to the unexplored beaches.Goa is beach where you have fun with Beach, sand and Sun.Baga beach,Cavelossim beach and more that are the major atraction among tourist. 
These 10 offbeat Beaches in South India will Make You Go WOW. Grab south tour packages and plan a trip to these beauties: Malappuram, Kerala: This beach is a beauty. The Shore temple lays here but it’s the scenic beauty and the wild waters that actually appeal. It’s a sight of timeless nature. 
Gokarna Beach, Karnataka: Serene and peaceful, Gokarna Beach is the best place for therapy. You will love the beauty, the peace and the views. 
Kappil Beach, Kerala: Kerala’s unexplored Kappil Beach is a beauty. Untouched by commercialism you will find peace so unknown in the other tourist-fested beaches. 
Rishikonda, Andhra Pradesh: This offbeat beauty is ideal for seeking some peace, picnicking and frolicking in the waters. It’s a beach with no comparison. The views seem to be taken from a painting of beach beauty. 
Benaulim Beach, Goa: This Goan beach trip is one of the beaches off the tourist circuit, beautiful views, serene ambiance is abundant here. Go off the tourist route and enjoy a day here. 
Cherai Beach, Kerala: Off the tourist grid, this beach is a natural beauty with views attractive and pleasant ambiance. It’s perfect for a day away from regular routines. 
Mary’s Island, Karnataka: This is one of the unexplored beauties of Karnataka. The beach seems foreign and not one from India. The views are picturesque and a day spent here is memorable. 
Ganpatipule, Maharashtra: The serene beach of Maharashtra is perfect for a getaway from cities. The natural beauty of soft sands, soothing waves, charming sunrises and sunsets creates a cherished memory. 
Karaikkal Beach, Pondicherry: Pondicherry beaches are blissful natural beauties often nicknamed as French Rivera of India. The beaches are scenic, full of fun and every traveler shall be lost in its charm. 
Cavelossim, Goa: This Goa beach is free from tourist crowds. The picturesque natural beauty of sands, waters, palms shading the area and the charm calls for a visit. Source: Free Articles from ArticlesFactory.com ABOUT THE AUTHOR
